protein.specific_function: May play a role in the regulation of extra-urea cycle arginine metabolism and also in down-regulation of nitric oxide synthesis. Extrahepatic arginase functions to regulate L-arginine bioavailability to NO synthase. Since NO synthase is found in the penile corpus cavernosum smooth muscle, the clitoral corpus cavernosum and the vagina, arginase II plays a role in both male and female sexual arousal. It is therefore a potential target for the treatment of male and female sexual arousal disorders.

go_class.description: hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds
hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds, in linear amidines
cellular amino acid and derivative metabolic process
glutamine family amino acid metabolic process
maternal process involved in female pregnancy
negative regulation of nitric-oxide synthase activity
negative regulation of striated muscle contraction
regulation of nitric oxide biosynthetic process
